Red Hot Chili Peppers History and Biography

Red Hot Chili Peppers are a rock band from Los Angeles, California, consisting of Anthony Kiedis, Michael 'Flea' Balzary, John Frusciante and Chad Smith.

Formed in 1983, the band released their self-titled debut album the following year. The band have released 11 studio albums to date, including 1991's Blood Sugar Sex Magik, that won the band their first Grammy Award, and their most recent, 2022's 'Unlimited Love' and 'Return of the Dream Canteen'.

Since the early 1990s, the band have headlined some of the world's biggest festivals, having appeared at the likes of Lollapalooza, Reading and Leeds, Fuji Rock, Oxygen and Coachella, as well as headlining their own arena and stadium tours across the US, Europe and the UK.

Red Hot Chili Peppers take their Unlimited Love Tour across North America in Summer 2024, which includes headlining slots at Bonnaroo in Manchester, Tennessee in June, and Minnesota Yacht Club Festival in July. Catch them live by checking tour dates and ticket information here on Stereoboard.
